pages.text: Herbs are an essential part of Roots. They are required in crafting, in rituals and in the creation & casting of spells.$(br2)The first herbs you are likely to discover are found when breaking ferns and grass: $(l:herbs/terra_moss)terra spores$() and $(l:herbs/wildroot)wildroot$().$(br2)These are also important ingredients used in many early recipes and rituals.

pages.title: Renewable
pages.text: While you could spend time breaking grass in order to build up a large supply of these herbs, there are alternatives.$(br2)$(l:herbs/terra_moss)Terra Moss$() (the only herb that does not grow on soil of some description) is $(l:herbs/renewable_resources)renewable$() through the $(l:rituals/ritual_overgrowth)Overgrowth Ritual$().$(br2)Besides the elemental herbs ($(l:herbs/infernal_bulb)Infernal Bulb$(), $(l:herbs/dewgonia)Dewgonia$(), $(l:herbs/cloud_berry)Cloud Berry$() and $(l:herbs/stalicripe)Stalicripe$()) all herbs can be grown as crops on normal farmland.

This allows for an early, $(l:herbs/renewable_resources)renewable$() source of $(l:herbs/wildroot)wildroot$().$(br2)A few herbs, $(l:herbs/spirit_herb)Spirit Herb$(), $(l:herbs/pereskia)Pereskia$(), and $(l:herbs/wildewheet)Wildewheet$() must be crafted into seeds (or bulbs) before they can be replanted.$(br2)$(info) Elemental herbs must be grown on elemental soil, of any of the five kinds. Matching the herb to a specific elemental soil type is not required.

pages.title: Unlocking Herbs
pages.text: You will not immediately be able to access all herbs upon starting Roots. A number of them require the use of a specific tool for creation, while others require a crafting ritual on the Pyre.$(br2)The recipe for each herb is specified in its entry, and can be crafted as many times as you like.$(br)$(info) It is always worthwhile to grow herbs as crops after your initial crafting.

pages.title: Completion
pages.text: To complete this entry, collect one of each of the herbs, either by crafting them in a $(l:crafting/pyre)pyre$(), through trading with villagers or by finding them in the wild.$(br2)There are 11 in total, and you can track them with the $(adv:roots:all_the_herbs_3)$() advancement.
